talk.utter: I really like eating alone at restaurants! I used to happily travel alone all the time and I honestly didn’t know some people thought it was some kind of taboo until pretty recently. I am also a weird misanthrope who reads in bars.

talk.author: did:plc:cqlzpe65zxyqzpgyogx7wqsj
talk.utter: I first learned that this is an issue for people via an UNHINGED conversation with a coworker who said he saw a sex worker eating lunch at his hotel. How did he know she was a SW? Because she was eating alone at the restaurant and non-SW women never do that. 85 different levels of WTF ensued.

talk.author: did:plc:ixat7plj5fnn6urilmf7mat7
talk.utter: I can’t believe this is how I found out I’ve been a sex worker for decades.

talk.author: did:plc:cqlzpe65zxyqzpgyogx7wqsj
talk.utter:
I thought 3 things were self-evident:
1. That's a weird assumption.
2. So what if she was?
3. Eating alone in public is fine and normal for people of all genders and professions.

Everyone was with me on 1 and 2, but 3 is apparently completely outrageous.
